short_description: This function is used to generate morph of given words in the input dataset.
long_description: This function is used to generate morph of given words in the input dataset.

input_tables.name: InputTable
input_tables.rDescription: The table that contains the input dataset.
input_tables.description: The table that contains the input dataset.

argument_clauses.name: WordColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specify the name of the input column that contains words, for which morphs to be generated.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the name of the input column that contains words, for which morphs to be generated.

argument_clauses.name: POS
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the part of speech to output.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the part of speech to output.

argument_clauses.name: SingleOutput
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specify whether to output only one morph for each word. If user specifies 'false', the function outputs all morphs for each word.
argument_clauses.description: Specify whether to output only one morph for each word. If user specifies 'false', the function outputs all morphs for each word.

argument_clauses.name: POSTagColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specify the name of the input table column that contains the part-of-speech (POS) tags of the words, output by the function TD_POSTagger.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the name of the input table column that contains the part-of-speech (POS) tags of the words, output by the function TD_POSTagger.

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the input columns to copy to the output table.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the input columns to copy to the output table.
